definition: to dismiss/to discharge/to fire
old variant of 辭|辞[ci2]
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw

sentences.english: Carder was later removed by the Committee.
sentences.chinese: 后来委员会辞退了卡利亚。

sentences.english: When the building was completed, he paid off the workers.
sentences.chinese: 这幢楼建成后，他就辞退了工人。

sentences.english: The absolved Swiss absence kissed the already missing missile and scissors.
sentences.chinese: 被辞退的瑞士小妞吻了一度失落的导弹和剪刀。

sentences.english: The employee was dismissed as incompetent.
sentences.chinese: 该雇员被认为不称职而遭辞退。

sentences.english: We had to send the girl away for stealing the silver.
sentences.chinese: 女佣人偷窃银餐具，我们只好把她辞退了。

sentences.english: But in his first season, the team is terrible and management fires him.
sentences.chinese: 谁知第一球季，球队的表现惨不忍睹，他因而被辞退。

sentences.english: This company has to be given credit for her ultimate annihilation.
sentences.chinese: 公司曾经借贷给她，最后她被公司辞退。

sentences.english: And with a hot stud like Donny Wright around it was easy to indulge.
sentences.chinese: 带一个热像唐尼辞退赖特围绕着它很容易沉迷。

sentences.english: I lost a steady income after I was fired.
sentences.chinese: 辞退后，我就失却了稳定的经济来源。

sentences.english: THANKS to slumping markets, investment banks are shedding many of their highly-paid traders.
sentences.chinese: 由于市场不景气，投资银行辞退了许多高薪交易员。

sentences.english: That I would be dismissed by the Huangshi Municipal Public Security Bureau is a conclusion I've anticipated for some time.
sentences.chinese: 我被黄石市公安局辞退，这是我早已预料到的结局。

sentences.english: The grand master, Gong Yutian, intended to retire from Zhong Hua President of the knights.
sentences.chinese: 一代宗师，宫羽田打算辞退中华武士会会长职位。

sentences.english: He gave all the servants, but me, notice to quit.
sentences.chinese: 他把所有的仆人，除了我，都辞退了。

sentences.english: As I said, getting fired can happen to the best of us.
sentences.chinese: 就像我说的一样，即使是最优秀的人都有可能被辞退。

sentences.english: She laid off 36 thousand employees, and acknowledges their resentment.
sentences.chinese: 她辞退了三万六千员工，了解他们的反感。

definition: to dismiss an employee/to sack
to expel (a member of an organization)/to fire (an employee)
to try to persuade sb to give up (their job, plans etc)
to fire/to sack/to dismiss/to terminate employment
to resign
to suspend (sb) from duties
to retire/to leave office/to quit a job
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
to demote (to a lower rank)
to skip work/absence without leave
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
to keep an official position/to hold on to one's job
to cut staff/to lay off employees
to admit responsibility and resign
to cut wages
to hire (an employee)/to accept (a manuscript) for publication
